Test Case: Verify a push notification is received exactly 2 hours before an order's delivery deadline (at 9:59 PM).
Precondition:
- A courier is logged in and has an active order in the "My orders" tab.
- The order has a delivery date and time set.
- The current time is exactly 2 hours before the order's 11:59 p.m. delivery deadline (i.e., 9:59 p.m. on the delivery day).
- The device has an active internet connection.
- App permissions for notifications are enabled.
Steps:
- Set up an order with a specific delivery date.
- Advance system time (or wait) until it is exactly 9:59 p.m. on the delivery date.
- Observe the device's notification bar/center.
Test Data:
Customer: John Doe
Address: 123 Main St, Apt 4B
Phone Number: +1234567890
Delivery Date: 2025-07-25
Rental period: 1
The scooter's color: black
Expected Result: A push notification appears with the text: "2 hours to the end of the order. The order "State St 1214" must be completed before 11:59 p.m. If you can't make it in time, alert support: 0101".
Environment:
Android Studio v2025.1.1
Emulated device: Pixel 5, Android 12

Test Case: Verify the content of the 2-hour delivery reminder push notification.
Precondition:
- Test Case N-01 has been executed and passed.
- The push notification is visible in the notification bar/center.
Steps:
- Open the notification bar/center.
- Read the text of the push notification.
Test Data:
Customer: John Doe
Address: 123 Main St, Apt 4B
Phone Number: +1234567890
Delivery Date: 2025-07-25
Rental period: 2
The scooter's color: grey
Expected Result: The push notification contains the exact text: "2 hours to the end of the order. The order "State St 1214" must be completed before 11:59 p.m. If you can't make it in time, alert support: 0101".
Environment:
Android Studio v2025.1.1
Emulated device: Pixel 5, Android 12

Test Case: Login screen: Verify "No Internet connection" pop-up appears when an active button is tapped without internet.
Precondition:
- Application is open on the login screen
- Internet connection is disabled (Wi-Fi off, Mobile Data off).
Steps:
1. Disable the device's internet connection.
2. Tap on active buttons or interactive elements within the application.
Test Data: Login button, question mark button, "I don't remember my password" link
Expected Result: The "No Internet connection" pop-up is displayed.
Environment:
Android Studio v2025.1.1
Emulated device: Pixel 5, Android 12
Actual Result: Login and "I don't remember the password" links do not throw a "No internet connection" error when mobile and internet connections are down.

Test Case: All orders screen: Verify "No Internet connection" pop-up appears when an active button is tapped without internet.

Test Case: Verify "No Internet connection" pop-up disappears only after tapping "Ok".
Precondition:
- The "No Internet connection" pop-up window is currently displayed.
- Internet connection remains disabled
Steps:
1. Attempt to tap outside the pop-up window or use the device's back button (if applicable) without tapping "Ok".
2. Tap the "Ok" button on the pop-up.
Expected Result: The pop-up remains visible until the "Ok" button is tapped. Once "Ok" is tapped, the pop-up notification closes.
Environment:
Android Studio v2025.1.1
Emulated device: Pixel 5, Android 12
Actual Result: Tapping outside the pop-up will also close it.

Test Case: Verify "No Internet connection" pop-up re-appears on subsequent active zone tap if connection is still off.
Precondition:
- Internet connection is disabled.
- The "No Internet connection" pop-up was previously displayed and closed by tapping "Ok"
Steps: 1. After closing the "No Internet connection" pop-up (internet still off), tap on another active button or interactive element.
Expected Result: The "No Internet connection" pop-up notification re-appears.
Environment:
Android Studio v2025.1.1
Emulated device: Pixel 5, Android 12

Test Case: Verify application functions normally after re-establishing internet connection.
Precondition:
- The "No Internet connection" pop-up was previously displayed.
- Internet connection is currently disabled.
Steps:
1. Enable the device's internet connection (Wi-Fi or Mobile Data).
2. Tap the "Ok" button on the "No Internet connection" pop-up (if still open), or tap any active button if it has already been closed.
3. Perform an action that requires internet (e.g., attempt to log in, refresh order list).
Expected Result: The application performs the intended action, demonstrating that the internet connection has been successfully recognized and utilized. If the action that triggered the pop-up was an attempted login, it will re-attempt to log in.
Environment:
Android Studio v2025.1.1
Emulated device: Pixel 5, Android 12
